**SolarCity Revival**: Implement a city-wide solar panel installation program, offering residents a discounted rate for installation. Partner with local businesses to provide financing options and incentives for homeowners to upgrade to solar energy. Create a community-driven initiative to promote energy efficiency and sustainability, with a goal of powering 100% of the city's homes with solar energy within 5 years.

**SolarShare**: Develop a peer-to-peer solar energy sharing platform, allowing residents to share excess energy generated from their solar panels with neighbors who don't have their own installations. This not only reduces energy costs but also fosters a sense of community and cooperation. Introduce a rewards system to encourage residents to contribute to the shared energy pool.

**SolarSprint**: Launch a city-wide competition to design and install innovative solar-powered homes, showcasing the latest in sustainable architecture and energy-efficient design. Partner with local universities and industry experts to provide resources and mentorship for participating teams. The winning designs will be showcased in a city-wide exhibition, promoting the benefits of solar energy and inspiring others to follow suit.

**SolarCycle**: Introduce a city-wide solar-powered transportation system, utilizing electric buses and shared mobility services to reduce carbon emissions and promote sustainable transportation. Partner with local government agencies and private companies to develop and implement the system, which will also provide a convenient and affordable transportation option for residents.

**SolarStep**: Develop a community-led solar panel installation program, focusing on low-income and marginalized communities who may not have access to traditional financing options. Partner with local non-profits and community organizations to provide education, training, and support for residents to take control of their energy costs and promote energy justice. The program will also provide a platform for residents to share their experiences and advocate for policy changes to support solar energy adoption.
